data.meta_site_name: Snug Harbor Cultural Center & Botanical Garden
data.text:
Snug Harbor Cultural Center & Botanical Garden’s 83-acre campus boasts a multitude of spaces for all types of film and photo projects. It has been used as everything from a college campus to a park, homes and apartments to a hospital, an opera house to a dance hall.

We’ve been proud to work with production teams from The Bride, Law & Order SVU, Fosse/Verdon, Wonder Wheel, Gotham, God Friended Me, Madame Secretary, Life Itself, Katy Perry, and Lady Gaga, among many others. For inquiries, contact Jordan Kimbrough at jkimbrough@snug-harbor.org or 718-425-3516.

Creative minds can find opportunities to shoot in every nook and cranny of the campus. The buildings represent the changing architectural styles of the 19th and 20th centuries. The first buildings were built in the Greek Revival style. Others demonstrate marked Beaux Arts, Renaissance Revival, Second Empire and Italianate styles with high Victorian decorative components. Many of the indoor spaces are unfurnished, providing a blank canvas for a set. Expansive outdoor spaces provide a unique setting as the seasons change.

Indoor spaces include:

Music Hall

Art Galleries

Carpenter’s Shop

19th Century Residences

Basements

Greenhouses

Dance Studios

Classrooms

Unique hallways, stairways and other architectural features
